title: I am permanently suspended for no reason
body:
I reset my password a few times and eventually didnt get a password reset email. After vacation, i came back and saw that I am now permanently suspended. It says i can check my email to see the details, but i have no email about it. I sent a ticket, but no one has replied to it yet. Is there a way to get in more direct contact with Riot or a way to get my account unsuspended?

edit: after reading some of the posts here, i would only assume its because of being accidentally banned with the mods or whatever or due to being toxic. I have not used any kind of mod or addon or anything for league and how would they see that i havent used any or have any stuff on my computer? i also have never had a ban for being toxic, only having been chat blocked for a few games a while back. 

update: still no word on my tickets or anything of the sort, though i did get an email confirmation email yesterday, so that is hopeful. hopefully riot will fix fast so i can buy a few champions and remember what league is xD

The same situation has happened to a number of people. Including an account of mine. I was able to contact player support, and was told as follows:
 	

Legendary (Riot Games Player Support)

May 18, 16:01

Greetings again,

This lock was actually due to a manual review of the account by a Rioter and wasn't a result of any action taken by our Instant Feedback system so that is why there isn't a specific reform card/email for this. Also for some extreme behaviors like intentional griefing/feeding it is very clear to the majority of our players that it isn't acceptable and is why these locks can be issued without any warnings.

Legendary
Player Behavior & Game Support
Jarvan IV Jungle
"For the King!"

I had received chat restrictions a week prior, and I suppose I must have unknowingly said or done something worthy of a ban. As I see it, though, they're starting to look over reports much more closely rather than allowing the "Instant Feedback System" to handle the majority of them. I assure you, if you had received a permanent suspension with no e-mail, and no reform card in client, it was result of a Rioter finding something that you had done wrong. It's a bit awry that they implemented this prior to notifying the player base as a whole. Although I suppose the banning of Tyler1 woke them up a bit in regards of negative players. You're still free to create a new account, though. So good luck {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
